page.title: 03GARDEN SUBURB INSTITUTE
page.content:
From an interview with the Vice- Principal of the Institute by children from Garden Suburb School:
The Hampstead Garden Suburb{Institute is an{Adult Education Centre.}It was built in 1909 by a famous architect called{Edwin Lutyens.}Now it has classes in the daytime and evenings for people from the ages of 8 to 80. The classes are in{languages, art}and many different{crafts.}Lots of foreign people come to learn English at the Institute, especially au pairs from the rich houses in the Suburb. The Institute is insured for over 2.5 million pounds as it is a special {listed building.}Part of the building is used by the Henrietta Barnett School which is a secondary school for girls.
